articles.title: January Planning Meeting Minutes
articles.summary: This document compiles the minutes and programs of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers' meetings from January through December 1956, detailing their club activities, astronomical presentations, and administrative decisions. It includes records of planning and general meetings, discussions on celestial objects, reports on telescope purchases and grinding, officer elections, and the club's by-laws. The content provides a snapshot of an amateur astronomy club's operations, educational initiatives, and social events during the mid-1950s.

articles.title: January Meeting Program Announcement
articles.summary: The document chronicles the 1956 activities of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers, detailing their monthly general and planning meetings from January through December. It includes program announcements for talks on various celestial objects and astronomical topics, meeting minutes, and discussions on club business such as officer elections, telescope acquisition, and proposed affiliations. The club's by-laws are also provided, outlining its structure and operational procedures.

articles.title: February Planning Meeting Minutes
articles.summary: This document compiles the meeting minutes and program details for the San Jose Amateur Astronomers from February to December 1956. It outlines planning and general meetings, featuring discussions on astronomical topics like planets and constellations, ongoing astronomy courses, and various club business. Key activities included telescope acquisition and grinding, organizing star parties, Lick Observatory visits, and holding elections for new officers, culminating in the formalization of the club's by-laws.

articles.title: February Meeting Program Announcement
articles.summary: This document chronicles the activities of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers throughout 1956, detailing monthly general and planning meetings, program announcements, and meeting minutes. Key topics include astronomical presentations on planets and constellations, the progress of a club astronomy course, discussions on club operations such as acquiring a telescope, membership, and affiliation with other organizations, culminating in the annual election of officers. The document also provides comprehensive by-laws governing the club.

articles.title: Constellation Leo Detailed Description
articles.summary: The document compiles the activities of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers club from February to December 1956, featuring detailed meeting minutes, program agendas, and educational content on constellations and planets. It highlights regular meetings, guest speakers, astronomy courses, and observing events like star parties. Organizational matters such as officer elections and by-laws amendments are also documented, alongside a comprehensive description of the constellation Leo.

articles.title: February General Meeting Minutes
articles.summary: This document compiles the meeting minutes of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers from February to June 1956, including various planning meetings, along with the club's comprehensive by-laws. The minutes detail regular astronomical presentations, discussions on club activities such as telescope purchases and star parties, officer elections, and educational courses. The by-laws outline the club's structure, membership, meeting procedures, and responsibilities of its board and officers.

articles.title: March Planning Meeting Minutes
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers actively met throughout early 1956, conducting regular general and planning meetings. These sessions featured educational talks on various planets and constellations, progressed an ongoing astronomy course, and included practical observing reports. Key organizational activities involved the purchase of a club telescope, the election of new officers, and the establishment and amendment of club by-laws, alongside planning for star parties and visits to Lick Observatory.

articles.title: March Meeting Program Announcement
articles.summary: The provided document details the activities of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers from March to December 1956, encompassing regular monthly meetings, planning sessions, and club business. Meetings featured educational programs on planets and constellations, an ongoing astronomy course, and special presentations. Key club decisions included the purchase of a club telescope, discussions on joining larger astronomical organizations, and the election of new officers, culminating in the formalization and amendment of club by-laws.

articles.title: March General Meeting Minutes
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers held their March 19, 1956, meeting where members approved the purchase of a 4-inch telescope and elected Dr. Finnerson as an honorary member. The program included presentations on Mars and an astronomy course, a talk by Dr. Bidelman from Lick Observatory, and a film, concluding with an informal observing session at a member's home.

articles.title: April Planning Meeting Minutes
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers held a series of monthly and planning meetings from April to December 1956, focusing on educational presentations about planets and constellations, alongside a multi-session astronomy course. Key activities included the acquisition of a club telescope, planning for star parties and visits to Lick Observatory, and holding elections for new officers. Discussions also covered potential affiliations with larger astronomical organizations and the formalization of club operations through the distribution of by-laws.

articles.title: April Meeting Program Announcement
articles.summary: This document compiles the minutes and program announcements for the San Jose Amateur Astronomers club from April to December 1956. It details monthly meetings, planning sessions, officer elections, and discussions on club affiliations and by-law revisions. Key activities include educational talks on constellations and planets, acquisition and use of a club telescope, and plans for star parties and visits to Lick Observatory.

articles.title: May Planning Meeting Minutes
articles.summary: The documents outline the minutes for a May planning meeting and the agenda for an April meeting of the Bay to A Amateur Astronomers. Discussions at these meetings covered planning educational programs, including specific speakers and topics, and evaluating potential affiliations with larger astronomical organizations like the Western Amateur Astronomers. Future activities such as a star party on Mt. Hamilton during the Mars conjunction were also discussed, alongside internal club matters like officer elections, by-law revisions, and acquiring instructional materials.

articles.title: May Meeting Program Announcement
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers held regular meetings and planning sessions from May to December 1956, featuring educational programs on various planets, constellations, and astronomy courses. The club was active in administrative matters, conducting officer elections, discussing by-law revisions, and planning numerous observing events including star parties and a visit to Lick Observatory. Key astronomical interests included the Mars conjunction, a lunar eclipse, and discussions on telescope optics and future topics like radio astronomy.

articles.title: May General Meeting Minutes
articles.summary: The May meeting minutes for the San Jose Amateur Astronomers document both club administrative discussions and the proceedings of their May 21, 1956 general meeting. Club business included planning for a convention, considering by-law revisions, and discussing uniform apparel, alongside the appointment of a nominating committee. The general meeting featured presentations on Saturn, constellations, and telescope optics, concluding with the announcement of officer nominations for the upcoming election.

articles.title: June Planning Meeting Minutes
articles.summary: The article contains meeting minutes from a May 1996 general meeting and a June 1956 planning meeting. The May meeting featured astronomical presentations on constellations and planets, a discussion on telescope optics, and the presentation of officer nominations for the upcoming elections. The June planning meeting outlined the agenda for the next general meeting, which included more astronomy talks and the scheduled elections, concluding with an impromptu observing session.

articles.title: June Meeting Program Announcement
articles.summary: This document compiles meeting minutes and program announcements for the San Jose Amateur Astronomers from June through December 1956. It details the June officer elections, regular monthly meetings covering astronomical topics like constellations and planets, and various club activities including planning sessions, observing events, and discussions on by-laws. The club focused on educational programs, administrative functions, and fostering member engagement through talks, observing opportunities, and social gatherings.

articles.title: June General Meeting Minutes
articles.summary: This document contains the minutes from both the June Planning Meeting (June 6, 1956) and the June General Meeting (June 18, 1956) of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers. The general meeting featured educational presentations on Lyra, Uranus, and a course in astronomy, alongside the election of new officers for 1956-57, including Bob Ferguson as President and Don Anderson as Vice-President. It also announced upcoming club activities and an observing session.

articles.title: July Meeting Program Announcement
articles.summary: This document chronicles the activities of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers from June to December 1956, including detailed minutes from past meetings, program announcements for upcoming sessions, and the club's comprehensive By-Laws. It covers regular astronomical presentations, club elections, planning for star parties and observatory visits, and administrative discussions on membership and governance.

articles.title: August Meeting Program & Coming Events
articles.summary: This document chronicles the activities of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers from August to December 1956, detailing monthly meeting programs, officer elections, and various club initiatives. Key highlights include presentations on celestial objects, announcements for public star parties and Lick Observatory visits, and the establishment of a 'Principal Speaker' program. A significant portion is dedicated to the club's by-laws, outlining its organizational structure, membership classes, officer duties, and governance procedures.

articles.title: September Meeting Program Announcement
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers club held regular monthly meetings and planning sessions between July and December 1956, covering diverse astronomical topics and organizing public observing events. Meeting programs featured discussions on planets, constellations, star names, book reviews, and reports on Mars observations, alongside announcements for star parties and visits to Lick Observatory. The document also includes the club's detailed by-laws, outlining its organizational structure, membership types, meeting procedures, and roles of the Board of Directors and officers.

articles.title: October Meeting Program Announcement
articles.summary: This document details the activities of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers during late 1956, including announcements for monthly meetings, their programs featuring astronomical talks and observing sessions, and records of past events like public star parties and Lick Observatory visits. It also provides a comprehensive set of the club's by-laws, outlining membership, governance, and operational procedures as amended prior to December 4, 1956.

articles.title: November Meeting Program Announcement
articles.summary: This document outlines the San Jose Amateur Astronomers' activities from September to December 1956, detailing monthly meeting programs, planning sessions, and special events like public star parties and Lick Observatory visits. It also includes the club's comprehensive by-laws, defining its organizational structure, membership types, officer duties, and meeting protocols. The club regularly featured educational talks on celestial objects, observing techniques, and club projects, demonstrating an active and structured amateur astronomy community.

articles.title: November Planning Meeting Minutes
articles.summary: The San Jose Amateur Astronomers held their November 1956 planning meeting, finalizing the agenda for their upcoming general meeting which included presentations on the Moon, Cepheus, and Pluto. Key club initiatives were also discussed, such as establishing a principal speaker series, enhancing observing sessions with audience participation, and planning a star party for the lunar eclipse on November 17th.

articles.title: December Meeting Program Announcement
articles.summary: This document provides a detailed overview of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers club's activities in late 1956, primarily focusing on announcements and minutes for their November and December meetings. It outlines meeting programs, speakers, and planning discussions, alongside key operational topics like a planned star party, leadership changes, and financial guidelines. A significant portion of the document comprises the club's comprehensive By-Laws, finalized as of December 1956, which detail membership, governance, and meeting procedures.

articles.title: December General Meeting Notes
articles.summary: This document compiles the minutes from the November 1956 planning meeting and notes from the December 1956 general meeting of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers. It outlines program details for upcoming meetings, significant organizational decisions including officer roles and a planned star party, and provides a comprehensive set of the club's By-Laws covering membership, governance, and operational procedures.

articles.title: By-Laws of San Jose Amateur Astronomers
articles.summary: This document contains the By-Laws of the San Jose Amateur Astronomers, detailing the club's organizational structure, membership types, financial regulations, and meeting procedures, as amended up to December 4, 1956. It also includes meeting notes and proposed by-law changes from late 1956, along with records of discussions on club activities, leadership elections, and planned astronomical events like a star party during a lunar eclipse.
